See something missing from our collections? UVA students, faculty and staff can submit purchase recommendations or get materials through Interlibrary Loan. Faculty can also request office delivery of materials. To learn more about specific collections and collection news, see our Collections page.

Get Materials

  1. Purchase recommendation
  2. Available to order
  3. Interlibrary Loan
  4. LEO delivery

Course Reserves

  1. Search Virgo Course Reserves
  2. Search Collab Course Reserves
  3. Place items on Course Reserve

Data services at the Library are evolving to meet emerging research needs. We can help you access, install, and use UVA site-licensed research software; find, create, use, and analyze data; help develop and execute data management plans; and assist with submitting data sets to Libra or another repository. Our experts offer workshops and other forms of training, and are available for one-on-one consultation.

Get help with

  1. Data management
  2. GIS
  3. Data analysis (via StatLab)
  4. Data discovery & acquisition
  5. Research software support

The Library offers scanning, printing, and copying services. You can also connect to Library databases from off-Grounds (UVA community only). There are public computers in Brown and Clemons, but these are very popular so we recommend you bring your laptop for working in the Library.

  2. Request digitization

  4. Printing & photocopying
  5. Specialty equipment & software

Library staff are research experts who can help you navigate our resources to get your work done. We offer reference assistance, one-on-one or in-class instruction, short courses, and subject expertise, as well as consultations on data management and specialized fields like GIS and digital research and scholarship.

Explore our study spaces or check out equipment needed for your digital project. You can also reserve collaborative study rooms at several library locations.

The Library supports the movement to reform scholarly communication within the academy. Libra, UVA’s institutional repository, assists in this effort by enabling members of the UVA community to deposit their scholarship and data for preservation and open access. Our Information Policy service leads the Library’s effort to provide information about copyright law, including authors’ rights, fair use, and related issues affecting teaching, research, and publishing. Our open access press, Aperio, publishes discipline-leading, high-quality open access journals and books that are freely and immediately available online.

More Information

  1. Libra (UVA institutional repository)
  2. Aperio (open access publishing)
  3. Copyright Resources
